website_summaries.verdict: An excellent electric knife that is packed with useful features. An excellent product for a reasonable price.
pros: Has a one-touch safety lock and easy-release blades
cons: The casing can get warm with lengthy use, but this shouldn't affect quality

customer_reviews.title: Bad design causes casing to break.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. After only a couple uses, the casing broke. Part of the motor was pressing from the inside which caused the casing to break. My husband is an engineer, and says it is a design flaw. I am attaching a photo. Bad design.
customer_reviews.author: Julestim

customer_reviews.title: Knife body split open-2nd use.
customer_reviews.text: During its second use, while cleaning it, without doing any kind of physical damage or dropping it, the body split wide open. Useless.
customer_reviews.author: Normgan

customer_reviews.title: This knife will crack in your hands!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great electric knife except for one thing, the case quickly and mysteriously develops a crack and then falls apart. The first time it happened, I notified Cuisinart; and, to their credit, they replaced it. The replacement came in September, 2015. Now, November, 2015, the replacement is showing the same cracks! The case design or case material is seriously flawed. I suggest staying away from this product until Cuisinart solves the problem.
customer_reviews.author: exaramco

customer_reviews.title: JUNK. WARANTY DOES NOT COVER SHIPPING. COST OF ...
customer_reviews.text: JUNK. WARRANTY DOES NOT COVER SHIPPING. COST OF GETTING REPLACEMENT UNIT WOULD BE ALMOST AS MUCH AS ORIGINAL PURCHASE COST SO WARRANTY IS BASICALLY WORTHLESS. THE KNIFE BROKE IN LESS THAN THREE MONTHS. I HAVE GIVEN UP ON CUISINART AND WILL PURCHASE A DIFFERENT BRAND OF ELECTRIC KNIFE. I AM SO DISAPPOINTED WITH CUISINART, THEY JUST DON'T STAND BEHIND THEIR PRODUCT. i WILL NO LONGER BE A CUISINART CUSTOMER. i LOST WHAT I SPENT ON THEIR PRODUCT AND THEY LOST A FUTURE CUSTOMER OF THEIR RODUCTS.
customer_reviews.author: PETE45B

customer_reviews.title: Used 4 times and the Plastic Handle is cracked...Seller will not  replace
customer_reviews.text: I have used this knife 3 times since purchasing .. After each use the knife was cleaned thoroughly and put back in the original box and placed on the shelf in my pantry. 4th time I opened the box to use I noticed about a 3 inch jagged crack in the plastic handle of the knife. The crack may have been there all the time but worsened with time?? Purchased Nov 2014 and seller will not replace. The item was NOT damaged by my carelessness.
customer_reviews.author: mercantile man

customer_reviews.title: Vegans rejoice...a carving knife for tofu and bread
customer_reviews.text: Wow what an under powered piece of...turkey. Got this to carve meat...of course. Much better at carving bread. Think the designers might secretly be trying to convert everyone to vegan because it is a hassle to cut meat. This unit just lacks the power to really cut down through meat such as turkey, ham, my finger you get the drill. Went through a loaf of bread like a sharp knife through a loaf of bread though. Will do for now, but will definitely be looking for a non-vegan version soon.
customer_reviews.author: EMK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good electric knife that was bought to replace an identical model that I used for several years. I dropped the first one on a tile floor and broke it, but I liked it enough to seek out the same model. It is comfortable in the hand and cuts very well. The stand is very handy and hides the cord well. The blades are made for specific purposes (bread and meats) and both cut nicely. It gets four stars instead of five because it can be a little bit under-powered when cutting very dense meats like Canadian bacon.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw in casing
customer_reviews.text: I bought my knife November 2015. I only use it once a year -- on Thanksgiving. So this year was the third time I used it. The casing cracked and one piece fell out. It looks like it is in the exact spot as the break on one of the other reviews. I can see the same thing inside. My old GE electric knife lasted for decades. Wish I could buy another like it. I won't replace this knife.
customer_reviews.author: mickipugh

customer_reviews.title: More than bread you are in trouble
customer_reviews.text: Had a pretty large boneless ham to cut up. My old GE knife from the 70s finally gave out. It would easily handle carving meat. This one NOT SO MUCH. You could cut with it for about 5 minutes and then have to let it sit and cool off. Apparently name brand means nothing anymore. I expected more. Returned to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Earnest T.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp Knife with Button on the TOP
customer_reviews.text: The deal on 90% of the electric knives for me is the button on the bottom that have to be pulled slightly rearward to operate making nearly impossible to keep a grip and apply pressure when you are up to your elbows in Prime Rib juice :-) The button on the to is perfect as that is where you apply pressure anyway. The blades are sharp. The cleanup was easy. It mowed through (2) 15 lb Prime Rib with little effort!
customer_reviews.author: WinU

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after doing my own research but also reading the reviews. I had an older electric knife that came to its natural end. The two blade sets (bread and carving ) was a pleasant surprise. I have used it throughout the holiday season to carve our prime rib and several roasts. It worked like a dream even though I have a very nice set of high end carving knives. It is very smooth and has a great feel allowing for excellent control. I was able to easily cut some of the meat paper thin. I really love this knife and highly recommend it. The price is excellent as well!
customer_reviews.author: Jack and Gail

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful electric knife!
customer_reviews.text: This electric knife has worked great for me. I love it for slicing fresh bread. I have used it for slicing thru frozen foods to make smaller portions and works great for slicing turkey, ham, and roast beef. It has been especially helpful as it makes slicing easier for my arthritic hands. Sometimes I have a bit of trouble keeping pressure on the "on" button because of the arthritis in my hands.
customer_reviews.author: ConnieLyn

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this knife and was excited about the reviews. Not sure where all these good reviews come from. Feels very cheap in the hands, very weak power that failed to cut a 3 days old baguette that we were trying to bake into toasts. The handle will never more fit into the base on e removed as the wire is too thick for the slot where it is supposed to go (picture)
customer_reviews.author: Flavio, MI

customer_reviews.title: A little hard to put together
customer_reviews.text: I really like this knife because the cord doesn't disconnect from the body like my last one did. However, I have found it a bit difficult getting the blades to fit in the body. Instead of having both blades next to one another, these blades go in one ahead of the other. More like having one foot leading with the other foot behind. I accidentally inserted the blades upside down once. After figuring things out, I have been happy with the knife. The blades cut very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Bellyjel

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and awkward to use.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a woman with normal size hands, but this product was obviously designed for someone with much larger hands in mind. The unit is heavy and clunky and not easy to operate. I bought this for cutting homemade bread, but it just makes a mess of that job. The blades aren't even good quality. I'm not happy with this purchase at all. I have an old Kleen-Cut knife with a cheap plastic handle that cuts better than this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Holly B.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Knife!
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleased with this electric knife. I purchased it several months ago, and used it for the first time today. I sliced my way through a 10 pound ham with ease. My old knife required a lot of pressure on the switch, and I had to really push hard to make the cut. I have some arthritis in my hands, and would have to rest my hand during slicing. This knife was a breeze to keep on, and it is small and maneuverable. It was also sharp enough to cut without a lot or pressure. I've used several electric knives over my lifetime, and this one is the best by far (at least in this price range).
customer_reviews.author: KTucker

customer_reviews.title: Takes Some "Handling!"
customer_reviews.text: My daughter bought this for me because as i have aged I have lost strength in my hands. We buy the Costco Raisin/Nut Bread which is a substantial Boul. The bread is delightful with Irish Butter & English Breakfast Tea & although this knife helps I continue to have problems with holding it in place & using the knife for slicing. It isn't the knife's fault but my lack of strength. It does a great job of slicing a Roaster & Baked Ham.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara J. Macey

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Cuisinart electric knife for Thanksgiving this year. Carving our 25 pound turkey went well. Blades tend to bend if to much pressure is applied but carves very well. I would recommend this product to anyone that uses an electric knife on special occasions like Thanksgiving, Christmas, Easter, etc..
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality knife and stand
customer_reviews.text: I used this to carve our Thanksgiving day turkey, it worked great, much better than a carving knife. Stand, real wood, is also nice, has a place in the back to stuff the cord, looks good in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Anony Moose

customer_reviews.title: Weak
customer_reviews.text: When I first bought the knife I thought that it was just fine. I was using it for bread, roast, etc. But Then: I recently purchased a whole boneless rib-eye an was going to cut it up into individual steaks and vacuum-pack them. Before I was half way through, the knife began to get hot in my hand and then it kept cutting on and off until it tripped the GFCI breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Nickels

customer_reviews.title: Motor burned up within a month
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the placement of the on/off button on the top of the knife. Before being able to completely slice a loaf of bread, my thumb or index finger ached. I had to press pretty far into the knife. Also, I have had the knife for probably about a month. When using it a few days ago, the on/off button became flaky and it was difficult to turn on the blades. When I used it today, I had a difficult time turning it on. Within 15 seconds of use, I smelt a burning odor. The motor was burning up and smoke started rising from the innards of the knife. I will not be using it any more.
customer_reviews.author: KaLyn Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Second electric knife in two weeks. The first one ...
customer_reviews.text: Second electric knife in two weeks. The first one was a $15 from a box store-motor out on the first roast. This one cuts, but very slow. Ok for bread. Forget it for meat. I thought it was me. I thought I was not doing it right, so I had my girl friend ( a professional chef) use it. And within 30 seconds of using it, she said it has no power. I think I will just buy a very expensive regular knife. I cant find anything with real power. I am returning it, but wanted to put my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Arty Henne

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work with a bread slicing GUIDE
customer_reviews.text: There’s nothing “wrong” with the product - I guess - but it was lousy for MY purposes. For years, I’ve sliced my homemade bread using a slicing guide to get uniform thickness of slices. I thought this knife would save some of the “labor” involved in that process. The result, however, was “wedge-shaped” slices of bread - - normal thickness at the top and much, much thinner at the bottom. The last heel-end slice was a monstrously misshapen piece of bread - not much good for anything. I sent it back as unfit for the intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Peter W.

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Cut Bread
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Cuisinart CEK-40 for cutting bread after seeing it recommended in the book Modernist Bread. It does not cut bread. Perhaps it would cut sandwich bread or other soft breads. The blades are a little frightening but not long enough. Storage takes up a lot of room. Sadly this is possibly the best electric knife available for home use. So far I have not tried the meat blade. The knife may or may not work for meat.
customer_reviews.author: Cranky Old Woman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Electric Knife
customer_reviews.text: This knife does exactly what it's intended to, making quick work of a roast or brisket. I gave it three stars because Cuisinart's self-importance. The block shown in the picture is the only method of storage you get. As though this knife should be considered a show piece and displayed on your counter. Ummm...no. This would be a much better package if it came with a compact case in which to store it.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Riley

customer_reviews.title: Seems okay... Stand is poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The knife with two blades seems fine. I mostly use this for fresh baked bread so no problems there. The stand, which I thought would be nice, is rather poor quality. The plastic flap does not fit into the slot fully. The slot is not deep enough to accommodate the flap. The plastic feet are that - plastic - and not rubberized to prevent sliding. The stand is just "okay" and nothing to write home about. The stand will keep everything in one place which is good and it looks okay but that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles G. Gage

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a good value. Just used it the first time on Thanksgiving; cuts very nicely, fits the hand pretty well. Feels more solidly made than others by similarly reputable companies, in the general price range. (I compared models in various stores before buying.) Nice to have a separate bread knife. The board is not the most convenient storage unless you have spare counter space, but the stand can be left flat to store in a drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Steve G

customer_reviews.title: Do not take a chance.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second knife. I purchased this product because of the manufacturer. The knife probably works great. I have not used it but the stand was a big plus for me. The knife does not fit in the base! The previous model also did not fit. I should have saved money and returned this one. I have not needed to use it so I had not opened the box. My cut off date was two days ago. So I will toss the stand and pray the knife works. Do not take a chance! Two in a row tells the story.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Not good enough to cut sourdough bread
customer_reviews.text: Don't like the feel of this knife when you use it in your hand. Also bought this specifically to cut my homemade sourdough bread which has a touch crust and it wouldn't even get started to slice the bread...ugh. Returned the item.
customer_reviews.author: Josey Johnsen

customer_reviews.title: Plastic casing broke
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe something with the Cuisinart name is so poorly made. Case is plastic, has cracked already. Going to call and see if Cuisinart will replace. I had a Black and Decker, much less expensive and it lasted forever. I just needed new blades for the B and D and could not find, so I replaced with the Cuisinart. Looks nice, and when it works I have no complaints. I am seeing other people having the same problem. If they replace it I will give them a better review.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Great for someone with arthritic hands
customer_reviews.text: Bought this following hand surgery for a displaced tendon on the right index finger and arthritis of the hands. This has been a tool to be able to cut meat, vegetables, and other foods. Easy to insert / attach blades and clean the blades following use. It is a bit noisy (to each their own thresholds) but might not use if someone was sleeping nearby. No other similar products experience to compare the noise to. Happy with having the cord as I didn't see anything cordless with a good duration of operation. The cord doesn't really get in the way. There isn't a storage provided for the blade so I put it in a butcher block knife rack.
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control and customer service at Cusinart.
customer_reviews.text: Wood base slot was to short for the plastic support and didn’t work or fit. Requested a replacement and had the same issue. Requested another replacement and was referred to Cusinart directly. Another replacement was to be sent and the cord cut off of the one I had and sent to Cusinart at my cost. I was told the warranty would be voided if the cut cord wasn’t returned. Cusinart never sent a replacement and Amazon refunded the total cost once the second replacement was returned. Amazon 5 stars and Cusinart none.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sharp blades
customer_reviews.text: I primarily have used this knife for cutting my homemade rye breads. There are two included blades for bread and for meat products. The included mounting board holds everything together with swivel clamps. The only minor negative is how the handle is held in place. You really have to jam it in place as the slot opening is a tad bit too small and impinges on the electrical cord if not careful when storing. Cuts fine and blades are razor sharp after 30 loaves of hard rye bread. Great knife
customer_reviews.author: Ted Bates

customer_reviews.title: this is a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the same brand I had for years. It doesnt cut unless you push down on it. The on button works so hard and is hard to keep on. It also gets very hot in a short time. I have only used it for cutting homemade bread, I am afraid to even think what will happen with meat. I checked where it was made and that answers this being bad. Lets buy American. Have to put pressure on it to cut. On button works hard and keeps slipping off. It gets hot. t
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: Electric Knife
customer_reviews.text: This knife works great. We are using this to cut high density foam that is 4 inches thick. This works like a charm. Very sure it will cut up big hunks of meat but currently have been trying to eat less of that. Could also be useful for cutting the corn off fresh corn in the summer and then blanching it and freezing it for later on in the year.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Design
customer_reviews.text: I would give 6 stars if I could. Putting the power button on top the knife was a great idea. I've had other knives that require the power trigger to be pulled backward at a strange angle. To me this makes holding the knife not only uncomfortable but actually dangerous. The top button allows a firm and steady grip. Blades clean like all knives.
customer_reviews.author: Phillers

customer_reviews.title: Not for crusty bread!!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one in less than a year. It’s only used to cut sourdough bread. The motor runs but the blade stops. It’s happened twice and the company requires at your expense shipping the cord back and paying postage on the new knife while under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Denny

customer_reviews.title: Not happy, will contact manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: Problem when slicing meat. The blades gap just a hair but enough for meat to slip between blades which waste meat, makes the cut ragged and slows you down. Planning to return!
customer_reviews.author: Ginger S.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts very well!
customer_reviews.text: Carved up a super moist brisket with this carving set weeks ago. It cut the slices so easily without ripping or pulling the meat apart. I very much recommend this for carving nice straight edges as it bested my ultra sharp German steel set of knives with less effort.
customer_reviews.author: J. Garland

customer_reviews.title: works well, but the support for free-standing mode is ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but the support for free-standing mode is weak and it falls over. I had to find room in a drawer. That is the ONLY reason there aren't five stars. UPDATE: I hung it on the wall behind my counter. Perfect place. I do like the way the knife works. I've had it for over a year, now.
customer_reviews.author: NotAvailable

customer_reviews.title: Great knife for slicing homemade bread
customer_reviews.text: We got this knife for cutting our homemade bread. It does a great job at making thin smooth slices. Crumbs are less but still fly around. Didn’t try the meat blade but I’m sure it will be great too. My only complaint is the support doesn’t fit well the body of the knife. I think it sized wrong. The blades stay well in their place but the length for the body is too short so it is only suppprted by the bottom side.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Nice stand, too bad it doesn't actually work
customer_reviews.text: The knife is nice enough, comes with a meat blade set and a bread blade set. They work. The stand however, which is featured prominently in the marketing does not fit this model. It's as if halfway through design someone made the knife 3/4 of an inch longer & forgot to update the stand. Which makes it 100% useless for storing the motor/handle base. So, buy it if you just want to toss the knife set in a drawer.
customer_reviews.author: F.Oswald

customer_reviews.title: Dead!  It didn't even last a year!
customer_reviews.text: 10 months after I bought this and having used it a half dozen times, it jammed and broke. In the garbage. I thought I bought the best brand and was so pleased! By contrast I've had two previous electric knives, one a Hamilton Beach, that lasted for MANY years!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl A. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Overheats
customer_reviews.text: Gets extremely hot after a few minutes! I stop so it doesn’t over heat. Also the blades tend to bend and wobble in use. That being said it does get the job done! Just let it cool down when it gets hot so you don’t brun it out!
customer_reviews.author: Cdl

customer_reviews.title: Does not cut well.
customer_reviews.text: Fair price but so disappointed in the ability to cut through a roast!
customer_reviews.author: Mom-Mom

customer_reviews.title: What's the problem?
customer_reviews.text: I just received this knife so I cannot comment yet on the durability concerns about the handle. I can comment, however, about the stand. In other reviews, it was said that it was a piece of junk. No it's not. It seems very well made and attractive on the counter. It was also said that the handle will not fit into the stand. Yes it does and it holds it perfectly. Finally there were reviews that there is no place to store the cord. Yes there is, right in back if you use the counter stand. Did I get something different from these folks?
customer_reviews.author: John Covell

customer_reviews.title: The supplied storage base is stupid.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cut foam in Pelican shipping containers for a new product. It cuts foam great, but not by hand. I had to mount the knife vertically in a wire frame cart to get good straight cuts. No matter - that was easy. But the storage / display case was useless. The knife doesn't fit! It misses the mounting slots by 3/4"! What? Why do they waste money and users time to ship stuff that will ultimately go into the garbage can?
customer_reviews.author: Susan E

customer_reviews.title: Awesome knife
customer_reviews.text: Best knife on the market. So easy to use and clean. Super sharp and carves up a turkey faster then you can serve it for sure. The bread blades are also great
customer_reviews.author: The Adams

customer_reviews.title: Works well but stand did not fit electric knife!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the way this knife carves, unfortunately, the storage stand does NOT fit knife properly. Since this is probably an unbelievable complaint, I added a video to show the manufacturing defect. I will exchange it and hope the new one fits. I will update this review once I receive the replacement unit.
customer_reviews.author: ubercool

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit difficult to hold down the safety feature while using the knife, as required, but works great. Accidentally ordered two so passed the other along as a gift and it works well for the recipient also.
customer_reviews.author: TJH

customer_reviews.title: Good knife for a few months but quit working too soon
customer_reviews.text: The button is a little uncomfortable and slick to hold down and really have to push it hard to keep it going. It worked pretty well for 8 months but sparingly use it as I got it just for thanksgiving turkey and used it on bread a couple weeks ago and it started sounding funny and wouldn’t sync with the two knives to cut anymore.
customer_reviews.author: AV

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: used this to cut home made sour dough very tough stuff, if cutting a whole loaf it gets a bit warm, smells hot but cuts well, also works great for carving holiday prime rib nice straight cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really excellent for cutting insulation
customer_reviews.text: I saw a video regarding using this Cuisinart electric knife for cutting roll fiberglass insulation, and it works so much better than expected. It makes very nice accurate cuts, even longways for widths less than the standard 16" centers. The only downside is that it is corded, but that is a downside specifically related to how I am using it and not in any way a fault of the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: KuddlKat

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart CEK-40 electric knife
customer_reviews.text: I bought this electric knife to replace one that I had owned for 30 years. This is a wonderful product, and is easy to use. My husband does most of the carving at our house, and he is very happy with this knife.
customer_reviews.author: joy keaton

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: It was a replacement for an electric knife we had for years. It comes with two sets of knives which was a great idea. One for meats and the other for breads. I love the bread knives, works to perfection, perfect slices every time with no hassles. Love how it is stored in it's holder which can be left out for easy access. Looks great, performs great and didn't cost an arm and a leg, who could ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I will be searching for one with longer blades better weight distribution
customer_reviews.text: Just ok. I found this one to be awkward because of the un-even weight of it and the blades are shorter than my old one and I really miss that. I will be searching for one with longer blades better weight distribution.
customer_reviews.author: Threasa Ferrin

customer_reviews.title: Good electric knife and easy to grip
customer_reviews.text: I love this electric knife. Not only does it looks nice on my counter top, it works to slice meat or whatever is hard to slice with a knife. Makes the job of slicing faster and easier. My old one would start slipping out of my hand while I was slicing. This one has more of a textured grip.
customer_reviews.author: Linda McChesney

customer_reviews.title: Safety feature is to much
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis in my thumb impossible to press down have to press with both thumbs. The safety feature terrible. Hard to manage control over what’s being cut. When I have to use both hands to keep it on.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Sigler

customer_reviews.title: I can safely recommend this electric knife to anyone.
customer_reviews.text: I have had other electric knives, and none of them where as good as this one. Plus it is easy to assemble, also a problem I have had in the past with other electric knifes. It can make precision cuts, when it is guided properly. Just like a regular knife the results are up to the operator.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond W. Kent

customer_reviews.title: Loses power
customer_reviews.text: I love how this knife slices....once it gets started!!! I have to squeeze the trigger for 2-3 minutes in order to get it to turn on. Very frustrating!! Ive used it maybe 6 times. For the price, I expected more😡
customer_reviews.author: michelle bissett

customer_reviews.title: Too hot to handle
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Extremely Sharp, and cuts very clean. Problem is, a 3 minute cutting job is now turning into 2 days (work schedule). The knife overheats way too quickly, and takes too long to cool down. The knife will not operate and will automatically turn off when it reaches too high of a temperature. Thankfully I didn't buy it to cut this year's Thanksgiving turkey.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R.

customer_reviews.title: Love product!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace our well-used electric knife. We loved ours and didn't know if we would love it. My husband definitely loved the ease of assembly and use of. It's quiet and cuts very easily. Comes with a stand or can be fold up into storage.
customer_reviews.author: SDL52

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT come with case for storage!
customer_reviews.text: Just received today. Seems like a solid carving knife and will update this review after Thanksgiving. This short review is strictly based on value and packaging. For $25.00 they should include a plastic storage box as others do on knives that cost less. This obviously just a better way to store it keeping the knives and the hand held base together. Had I thought it wouldn’t come with a case I likely would not have purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Limited usefulness and I cannot recommend
customer_reviews.text: Just got the knife from amazon a few days back. We like to make bread in our house and for slicing bread this knife has enough leverage and power to evenly slice. Beyond bread the results are not good. Tried using to slice from a cheese block and the motor struggled and I struggled. I found it hard to get leverage and the motor was under powered. I found it easier to slice with a kitchen knife. Slicing ham yielded similar results - I found myself going back to a standard kitchen knife.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Troup

customer_reviews.title: Motor overheats easily, disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed, the engine on this knife overheats before I get through slicing a loaf of bread. Love the concept, this is my first electric knife. Have to press the on/off button very hard for use, probably because the engine overheats. Won't be sending it back because I'm tired of hand-slicing my homemade bread, but had higher hopes for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Fuchs

customer_reviews.title: Awesome knife, cheap stand
customer_reviews.text: Excellent knife with a terrible, flimsy stand- disappointing to give as a gift, it looks so high quality but the stand is junk. Wish it came with a nice storage case!
customer_reviews.author: J Mc

customer_reviews.title: Good cuts for Turkey, Ham and Chicken
customer_reviews.text: I have used this knife on this years 20 lb Thanksgiving Turkey, 10 lb pit ham, and a small 8 lb roaster chicken. The blade allows for nice easy cuts. I gave it 4 starts because the handle seems to get hotter than it should. This doesn't seem to cause any problems, but I paused my cutting a couple of times just to be sure the thing doesn't overheat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Been using bread slicers for years, and this one was a replacement. It makes the job of slicing homemade breads a breeze. Teeth are very sharp, and so be careful when cleaning them, don't slide any fingers along the blade, use a protective sponge only. Learnt this from experience.
customer_reviews.author: maiji

customer_reviews.title: Switch stopped functioning on first one purchased otherwise would have given 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I like this electric knife. It makes quick work of meats. However, the switch broke on my first one purchased after years of use. I would squeeze the button and nothing. Sometimes it worked and then cut-out right in the middle of carving. Very frustrating. The first unit also exhibited an electrical burning smell for the first couple of years right out of the box. Broke down and bought a replacement and the new one is working well so far after one month. No burning smell and switch works every time. Still loving the way it cuts. We shall see if my problems with the first unit pops up again with this one over time.
customer_reviews.author: Tally-Ho

customer_reviews.title: its the best that i could find.  it does cut very hard veggies.
customer_reviews.text: less expensive ones simply couldn't cut large root veggies, which is what i needed. this one will. really huge ones that are super hard makes the knife "struggle" but it does make the job of cubing soup veggies much easier. i recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: pamela harris

customer_reviews.title: supposedly the #1 best seller. I use it for cutting spoon roast(if ...
customer_reviews.text: head and shoulders over the previous one i just bought, supposedly the #1 best seller. I use it for cutting spoon roast(if you do not know what that is and you are a beef eater, you need to look it up and try it). The last electric knife I purchased struggled to cut thru it, i had to to bear down very hard, just basically useless. This meat blade is bigger and more aggressive and powers thru with ease. Worth the extra IMO.
customer_reviews.author: KenNQC

customer_reviews.title: Inferior designed product
customer_reviews.text: I like that it has bread cutting blades. They worked perfectly.The first knife was sent back to Amazon because the casing/handle cracked before we used it,so it was in the 30 day return policy. The second one broke in the same place, the day after the return policy ended. We taped it together till we find a reliable electric knife. I am very disappointed in Cuisinart for selling such a poorly made product.
customer_reviews.author: Jcapell

customer_reviews.title: Great buy if your still cutting a turkey with a knife
customer_reviews.text: My new best friend around the holidays. It saves time and makes great looking slices. I do wish it had more power (Tim the toolman Taylor) but I will upgrade as this is a more economically priced knife compared to others.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: a slimmer design would be better. The knife holder is a waste
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife to replace a Hamilton Beach electric knife that I have had for about over 40 years. This knife is affordable, and seems to work alright. The handle is bulky; a slimmer design would be better. The knife holder is a waste. I threw that out.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Not as tough as a Wisconsin cabbage
customer_reviews.text: My wife was making corned beef. She asked me to quarter the cabbage. Struck by a brain storm I retrieved the electric knife. One cabbage and the knife was hot, smelled hot and the blade did not reciprocate under load. Plastic gears? This knife is highly rated and not very expensive, but in hindsight I would happily payed 50$ more for something that would hold up to a cabbage. Should have grabbed the saws all.
customer_reviews.author: Jan L.

customer_reviews.title: It carves more than turkey.
customer_reviews.text: I look at reviews before I purchase...and everyone told the truth. I needed it to cut 4” high density upholstery foam...it did the trick. It did get a little hot but then again I did use it for something other than turkey. I have more cushions to cut and happy with the results so far.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen L.

customer_reviews.title: It worked. Will it last forty years as its predecessor did...
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement electric knife. It worked fine on the Easter ham. It is not as substantial as the Sunbeam electric knife that was in constant use since 1976. The packaging and non-knife bits and pieces probably cost as much as the knife in terms of total product cost. I doubt it will last forty years.
customer_reviews.author: Bob L.

customer_reviews.title: Can't cut pork roast!
customer_reviews.text: Please do not buy this product. I just threw my brand new electric knife in the rubbish after the first "test" cut. Shame on me for ignoring reviews. I bought it specifically to cut pork roasts for a wedding reception. Practiced with it this morning. It couldn't cut thru the first slice. I ignored that the handle couldn't fit into the base - it was 1/4" off. But if it can't slice thru a pork roast it's junk and won't give it kitchen space. Use a regular sharp meat knife - works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Connie-Dee C.

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted a year, with a 3 year warranty
customer_reviews.text: This knife tends to run warm if you use it a few mins. Mine totally quit working in a year. Cuisinart said it was on back order, and they would replace it with the next model up. Next model up, CEK-41 is a piece of crap, and knife itself is too bulky. Blade is too weak to cut up meat, just chews it up. Every time I have had to contact Customer Service, been on hold for over 20 mins. Will not purchase anything from Cuisinart again.
customer_reviews.author: Denise R.

customer_reviews.title: It's almost fun to use!
customer_reviews.text: After getting acquainted, I began looking for things to carve, planning our menu so I'd have more to carve... My last experience with electric carving knives goes back thirty years when I vowed to simply never try one again rather than experience that frustration again. From the first slice, I knew this knife and I would become best of friends at holiday meals.
customer_reviews.author: Jon G.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts are very even.
customer_reviews.text: I was able to cut turkey breast from a freshly cooked turkey in super thin slices, the way some family members like it. This slices very evenly and the blades are very sharp. Win-win.
customer_reviews.author: A. O. Reason

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like butter!
customer_reviews.text: NOW, finally, an electric knife that can REALLY, TRULY cut prime rib, turkey, pork roasts... Other knives have not really been up to the task, failing after an unacceptable number of uses. I suspect this one will last for QUITE some time! Thanks to all the other reviewers who recommended this one! You were all right.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L. Hall

customer_reviews.title: So far a decent electric knife.
customer_reviews.text: Just be careful, that with constant cutting it will get warm with use. Cutting a 15lb turkey, the unit was pretty warm. Had to stop intermittently to let it cool, then continue on.
customer_reviews.author: CackleFruit

customer_reviews.title: WORTH THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: GREAT knife set! I've used both blades several times on bread and meat and am absolutely delighted with its performance! Stay away from those other cheaper brands, save your money and buy this Cuisinart...it's worth the extra money! I personally like the stand for ready access but it would be easy to store away if you dislike clutter. I definitely speak from experience. When my wonderful 20+-year-old Presto electric knife finally died last year, I replaced it with a new and not so cheap Hamilton Beach. WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT!!! It was USELESS on everything...breads and meats.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Cannot press the on button if you have fingernails of any length.
customer_reviews.text: Pressing the on button is almost impossible if you have fingernails of any length. Trying to push made bruises on several places on my hand and started to bend my thumbnail back. The blades are jagged and the slightest touch on fingers caused cuts. I have been using a Hamilton Beach electric for many years and thought I would try a Cuisinart knife since I have other Cuisinart appliances and they are good products, but I got rid of the Cuisinart knife and ordered a Hamilton Beach knife again.
customer_reviews.author: Gram

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Used it a lot on various meats like chicken roasters. Cuts fast and easy to maneuver. Placing the handle in the storage unit requires some effort but nothing serious.
customer_reviews.author: Grampy

customer_reviews.title: Carve yourself a turkey!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this right before hosting my first thanksgiving. I was pretty nervous and I wanted things to go well. My mom always uses an electric knife when she serves turkey, so I decided to take a page out of her book and buy this one. It works beautifully! So simple to assemble, use and clean!
customer_reviews.author: Bianca

customer_reviews.title: Strong and easy to use electric knife
customer_reviews.text: Very strong knife - we love the two blade feature - we cut the bread for the turkey stuffing in nothing flat and same wirh the meat knife - it is very easy to use and handy since we set the holder on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: AnaHou

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart CEK-40 Electric Knife
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing negative to say about how it operated, I gave it 3 stars because it only lasted 4 years, maybe they just don't last as long as they used to. It wasn't over-used so I felt it should have lasted a lot longer,
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I like this knife and use it often. My hands are smaller, so it is a little hard for me to handle. Feels sturdy. Wish it had a storage hook or some way to store.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: No power.
customer_reviews.text: This knife looks and feels impressive, but it is so underpowered that it would not slice a beef bottom round roast. I had to get out a regular knife to slice it.
customer_reviews.author: Diane F

customer_reviews.title: Electric Knife which does the job
customer_reviews.text: With the festive season approaching, wanted to have my meats cuts evenly. Took the Amazon offer in early Dec., 2011 and since delivery, the Cuisinart has performed w/ excellent results after carving two turkeys, a tenderloin strip and a rack of roast beef. There's an on/off lock on the power trigger which is a solid safety feature. Blade release buttons are simple to use which makes cleaning easy. The storage case secures all components in a single area so when re-using, it doesn't become an exercise of re-locating each individual part. Motor provides enough torque to cut through bone joints and tendons. Am expecting that this kitchen tool will give many years of service.
customer_reviews.author: Rott boy

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 7 days and used for one Thanksgiving dinner. $15 total for shipping added now on total price for return and replacement
customer_reviews.text: Bought for Thanksgiving and the handle broke after one cutting of a full bird and a breast. I called Cuisinart and they told me I had to send it back with a $5 check for return shipping. It cost me $11 to ship it back with tracking and insurance. In the end $16 added to the total cost of the knife. I question why do we as a customer have to pay shipping on a product that was seven days old and used once. When it did work I was happy with it. Lets see how long the replacement last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great power for carving a turkey or roast
customer_reviews.text: Great for carving a Turkey. This electric knife has a great amount of power and makes carving a turkey or prime rib like cutting through butter 😉 You will also love the board in which the knives (you get 2) hold the Knives and electric unit . The other knife is good for cutting bread and also watermelon and pineapple . You won’t be sorry with this purchase.👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Wendi A

customer_reviews.title: this knife overheats within a couple of minutes
customer_reviews.text: i like cuisinart and have other products. this knife overheats within as couple of minutes. in my opinion, rendering it pretty useless.
customer_reviews.author: margaret  b.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: broke after two tri tips at the company BBQ, very dissapointing
customer_reviews.author: joseph Dean

customer_reviews.title: It worked on turkey, but not uncooked sweet potato
customer_reviews.text: The motor was not heavy duty enough to cut a raw sweet potato into 1/2" sweet potato slices. Motor got real hot after cutting one sweet potato. Therefore, I had to use a regular knife to finish the job. As far a cutting the Thanksgiving turkey, it worked fine. It will probably last my life time, but if I had to buy another one, I would try an get one with a heavier duty motor so I could use it for more than just the Thanksgiving turkey and Christmas spiral cut ham.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph E. Olive

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product. I make a lot of venison jerky ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. I make a lot of venison jerky for the grandchildren and it slices through the deer meat perfectly. A life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Vick

customer_reviews.title: Nice electric knife.
customer_reviews.text: Generally good, but I have to re-seat the blades once in a while --- they can work loose.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald G.

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer for carving meats
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after seeing how easy it is to carve a turkey on Alton Brown's Good Eats turkey brining episode. My husband says it's a game changer! He used to wrestle with the bird and it looked hacked apart, but with this knife he had it carved in no time and got much more meat off. Great!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie M

product_meta.title: Cuisinart Electric Knife, Black
product_meta.description: Style Name:1 BladeThe ideal combination of performance and versatility, the Cuisinart electric knife features a powerful motor and a full-size stainless steel blade to make short work of any slicing task. Serrated for superior cutting action and dishwasher safe, the blade slices meats and bread with speed and precision. The ergonomic, nonslip handle and one-touch on/off control make this knife especially easy to operate. Equipped with a 5-foot cord to carve right at the table! Features: Powerful and easy to use|One-touch on/off operation|Ergonomic handle comfortable for right- and left-handers|Stainless steel blade cuts through meats breads vegetables and more|Blade is removable and dishwasher safe|Limited 18-month warranty
feature_bullets: Powerful and easy to use. Cord length : 36 Inches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,415 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
